title: ACM@UCI is Founded
desc: Decades before companies like Amazon or Google are founded, years before the first ICPC, and even a year before ICS becomes a department at UCI, ACM@UCI is started as a local chapter of the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM).

title: ACM@UCI Competes in World Finals for the First Time
desc: After placing 2nd at the 1990 ICPC Southern California Regional (being beat only by a team from New Zealand), ACM@UCI advances to the ICPC World Finals, then known as the ACM Scholastic Computing Contest, held in San Antonio, Texas. The team of four ultimately places 14th.

title: ACM@UCI Competes in World Finals
desc: After placing 2nd at the 2013 ICPC Southern California Regional, ACM@UCI advances to the 2014 ICPC World Finals.

title: UCI 76ers Rank 1st Nationally at IEEExtreme 10.0
desc: ACM@UCI's team UCI 76ers places 1st in the US at IEEExtreme 10.0.
caption: UCI 76ers shortly after IEEExtreme 10.0

title: filter Competes in World Finals
desc: After finishing 1st at the 2016 ICPC Southern California Regional (including solving a problem in the last 24 seconds of the competition), ACM@UCI's team filter advances to the 2017 ICPC World Finals.
caption: Team filter after winning the 2016 SoCal Regional

title: UCI 76ers Rank 2nd Nationally at IEEExtreme 11.0
desc: ACM@UCI's team UCI 76ers places 2nd in the US at IEEExtreme 11.0.
caption: Students competing at IEEExtreme 11.0

title: filter Places 3rd in SoCal
desc: At the 2017 ICPC Southern California Regional, ACM@UCI's team filter pulls off another successful finish at 3rd place. Overall, ACM@UCI does extremely well, getting all 5 of its teams into the top 25.
caption: ACM@UCI members at the 2017 ICPC SoCal Regional

title: First Seminar Series
desc: ACM@UCI hosts its first seminar series, with students giving talks on computer science topics as diverse as gambling, medical imaging, and functional programming.

title: IEEExtreme 12.0
desc: At IEEExtreme 12.0, a 24-hour worldwide programming contest, ACM@UCI gets two teams, sheep and sleep24hrs, into the top 100 in the world. The two teams also rank 6th and 7th in the US, respectively.
caption: sleep24hrs shortly after IEEExtreme 12.0

title: 2018 SoCal Regional
desc: Despite losing most of its senior members, ACM@UCI teams pull off successful finishes at the 2018 SoCal Regional, with two teams, filter and iterator, ranking 7th and 9th, and all 5 teams ranking in the top 25 yet again.
caption: ACM@UCI members at the 2018 ICPC SoCal Regional

title: Seminar Series v2
desc: ACM@UCI hosts another seminar series, once again with diverse talks.
caption: Karthik Gajulapalli presenting for the ACM Seminar Series, Winter 2019
